p:
Substantial uncertainties in soil C-climate feedback existed as a result of different model structures, parameter values, and initial conditions. The conventional Century-type model predicted consistently positive soil C-climate feedback with small uncertainty, which indicates effectiveness of data-driven projections. The consistently positive feedback suggests that the model structure determines the trajectory of soil C response to climate change for this family of models
19 . These projections are consistent with Hararuk et al.
14 , who showed decreasing soil C under RCP 8.5 in a similar model to the one employed here, and are also within the predicted range in CMIP5 models
5 .
